[Rival Turned Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RivalTurnedEvil): To Sabin. The two were both Duncan's pupils, and Vargas claims Duncan favored him and so hates him.
[Walking Shirtless Scene](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WalkingShirtlessScene): He spends all his onscreen time stripped to the waist.

["Well Done, Son" Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WellDoneSonGuy): His antagonism towards Sabin is based on his believing that his father Duncan favoured Sabin and chose him to be his successor instead of him. According to Sabin, however, he misunderstood everything.

[What Happened to the Mouse?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatHappenedToTheMouse): He appears very early on, and is never seen nor heard from again afterward. Even immediately after the battle, it's unknown if he died or if he just ran away. His unique "death" animation makes it all the more ambiguous.

[Ascended Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AscendedExtra): Before this game, summons (excluding Bahamut and Odin) didn't get a lot of character exploration. Ramuh was no exception. This time, aside from Valigarmanda/Tritoch and Maduin, Ramuh could be considered *the* most plot-important Esper in the game, and his characterization here has heavily influenced his appearances in other games in the franchise.

[Cool Old Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoolOldGuy): The first (but not the last) time that Ramuh is characterized as this. In this case, he's introduced by taking care of Terra during her magical meltdown and spends the time after that watching over her and being magnanimous and helpful to the Returners.

[Fire, Ice, Lightning](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FireIceLightning): With Ifrit and Shiva. The dynamic become a plot point when you fight the other two in the Magitek Research Facility. After beating them, they recognized Ramuh's power and decided to help the party, revealing the three of them to be siblings in the process.
[Heroic Sacrifice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicSacrifice): Turns himself into Magicite to grant the party his power to help save the other Espers.
[Humanoid Aliens](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HumanoidAliens): Ramuh can pass for human, allowing him to travel through human cities incognito.
[The Mentor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheMentor): Has shades to Terra and the party, explaining many things to them and helping Terra learn to control her powers when she first transforms.

[Mr. Exposition](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MrExposition): Appears to plot dump a lot of backstory on the party, then performs a [Heroic Sacrifice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicSacrifice). However, he avoids [As You Know](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AsYouKnow); everything he brings up is stuff the party didn't know, or thought was only legend.
[My Greatest Failure](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MyGreatestFailure): He isn't very proud that he fled the Empire and survived while his friends were still trapped in the Magitek Facility.
[Shock and Awe](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShockAndAwe): Teaches Thunder and Thundara, and uses a Lightning-elemental attack when summoned.
[Small Role, Big Impact](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SmallRoleBigImpact): He only has one scene, but it shifts the entire tone and direction of the story.
[Everybody Calls Him "Barkeep"](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EverybodyCallsHimBarkeep): His true name is unknown.
[Good Wings, Evil Wings](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodWingsEvilWings): Has two white angel wings.
[Heroic Sacrifice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicSacrifice): Casts a binding spell to sweep the Empire out of the Esper realm, but he's so old it's implied he lost his life.
[Senseless Sacrifice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SenselessSacrifice): But by the time he does it, the Empire has already captured enough Espers to begin their campaign and keep it going for 20 years.
[The Atoner](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheAtoner): When the party encounters him and his companions in the mountains near Thamasa, he clearly feels awful about razing Vector.
[Killed Off for Real](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KilledOffForReal): He's transformed into magicite by Kefka along with the rest of the Espers at Thamasa.

[Unstoppable Rage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnstoppableRage): After emerging from the Sealed Gate, Yura and a number of other Espers go to Vector in search of the captured Espers from 20 years ago. Upon discovering that they died in the Magitek Research Facility, they fly into a rage and set Vector ablaze.

[Aborted Arc](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AbortedArc): Once the Returners try to wake it up, they forget about it for the rest of the World of Balance. Justified in that the first time they tried it, most of them almost got thrown into a chasm and Terra lost control of her powers and transformed the first time, so trying again would be risky to the point of stupid.

[And I Must Scream](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AndIMustScream): It still has some sense of awareness when inside the ice, able to defend itself with magic in the World of Ruin. Possibly subverted in that, once he finally wakes up, he's confused about whether or not the War of the Magi is still happening.
[Dub Name Change](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DubNameChange): In the SNES release as Tritoch. Let's be real here — ["Valigarmanda" was never going to fit](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterNameLimits).
[Fire, Ice, Lightning](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FireIceLightning): Teaches Firaga, Blizzaga, and Thundaga, and uses a tri-elemental attack when called into battle.

[Gameplay and Story Integration](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GameplayAndStoryIntegration): His being frozen in solid ice influences how his fight goes. He attacks with ice attacks, but is vulnerable to fire and armor-piercing attacks - in other words, being around him freezes the party, but they can melt and chip him out of the ice.

[Gameplay and Story Segregation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GameplayAndStorySegregation): While the Returners fail to wake Tritoch up the first time they try it and subsequently leave it alone for the rest of the game... unless you, as the player, make them go back and try again.
[Giant Flyer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GiantFlyer): Its field sprite is quite huge, even if it's likely not to scale.

[Harmless Freezing](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HarmlessFreezing): Ended up frozen in the glaciers north of Narshe. The lack of permanent harm is justifiable given that he's not only a powerful supernatural being, but one who has cold as part of his portfolio anyway.
[An Ice Person](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnIcePerson): Naturally, given he's frozen solid, his attacks are primarily ice-based when the party goes to break him out.

[Interface Spoiler](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InterfaceSpoiler): In the story, it's only ever referred to as "the frozen Esper", except that right at the start of the game in the Super NES version, when your party enters the battle screen to play out a cutscene, you can see its name displayed in the enemy listing. The GBA release changed this first scene so it is simply called "Frozen Esper"... but they did not change the second instance when this occurs after the battle with Kefka.

[Kill It with Fire](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KillItWithFire): Or rather, *free* him with fire by melting him out of his icy prison. Either that or chip him out of there with barrier-piercing attacks like the Phantom Rush, Locke's Valiant Knife or some of Cyan's Bushido techniques.
[MacGuffin](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MacGuffin): Its existence and the desire to obtain it drive the first several hours of gameplay.

[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): His [Dub Name Change](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DubNameChange) to **Tri**toch refers to his power over **three** elements: [Fire, Ice, Lightning](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FireIceLightning).

[Original Generation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OriginalGeneration): Unlike virtually every other Esper in the game, Valigarmanda isn't based on any kind of existing legend or myth, and is, so far as anyone knows, a totally original creation of the *VI* team.
    - On the other hand, it's possible his name is a portmanteu of [Vritra](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vritra) and Salamander.
[Sealed Badass in a Can](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SealedBadassInACan): One of the most powerful Espers in the game once you thaw it.
[Amazing Technicolor Population](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmazingTechnicolorPopulation): Shiva has blue skin, while Ifrit has green skin.

[Cold-Blooded Torture](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ColdBloodedTorture): The process by which the Gestahlian Empire extracts magic from Espers is painful and draining. When the heroes find Shiva and Ifrit, they've been so drained that they're close to death.
[Horned Humanoid](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HornedHumanoid): Ifrit has horns.
[An Ice Person](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnIcePerson): Shiva uses ice-themed attacks.

tropeName: I'm Dying, Please Take My MacGuffin
tropeNotes: [I'm Dying, Please Take My MacGuffin](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImDyingPleaseTakeMyMacGuffin): After the party battles them, they realize they're only minutes from death, and so turn themselves into Magicite so the party can use their power to avenge their torture at the Empire's hands.
[Kill It with Fire](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KillItWithFire): Ifrit uses fire-themed attacks.
[Stripperific](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Stripperific): Shiva only wears a single length of cloth around her torso.
[You Have Outlived Your Usefulness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouHaveOutlivedYourUsefulness): Kefka discards them in a pit for drained, dying Espers.
